summary: James K. Conzelman is identified as a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll certification reports from February 1977 to January 1978, indicating his employment with the committee during that period. The documents list his name, social security number, and salary, confirming his role as a paid staff member of the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: James K. Conzelman's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his duties is not detailed in these payroll documents, his employment indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during a portion of its investigation.
